metadata.title: USN-7188-1 -- FFmpeg vulnerability
metadata.description: It was discovered that FFmpeg incorrectly handled certain input, which could lead to an integer overflow. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service by crashing the application.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-7188-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  ffmpeg - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm9 ffmpeg-doc - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm9 libav-tools - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm9 libavcodec-dev - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm9 libavcodec-extra - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm9 libavcodec-ffmpeg-extra56 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm9 libavcodec-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm9 libavdevice-dev - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm9 libavdevice-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm9 libavfilter-dev - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm9 libavfilter-ffmpeg5 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm9 libavformat-dev - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm9 libavformat-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm9 libavresample-dev - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm9 libavresample-ffmpeg2 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm9 libavutil-dev - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm9 libavutil-ffmpeg54 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm9 libpostproc-dev - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm9 libpostproc-ffmpeg53 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm9 libswresample-dev - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm9 libswresample-ffmpeg1 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm9 libswscale-dev - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm9 libswscale-ffmpeg3 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm9 Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
